places.name: Taj Mahal
places.description: The iconic white marble mausoleum, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its stunning architecture and symbolizing eternal love.

places.name: Jaipur
places.description: The Pink City known for its vibrant culture, historic forts like Amer Fort, and the Hawa Mahal.

places.name: Goa
places.description: Famous for its beautiful beaches, vibrant nightlife, and Portuguese-influenced architecture.

places.name: Kerala Backwaters
places.description: A network of lagoons, lakes, and canals, offering picturesque boat cruises and a serene environment.

places.name: Rishikesh
places.description: A spiritual hub on the banks of the Ganges River, known for yoga, adventure activities, and the Laxman Jhula.

places.name: Mysore
places.description: Famous for the Mysore Palace, vibrant silk, and sandalwood markets, and the Chamundi Hills.

places.name: Ladakh
places.description: Known for its stunning landscapes, high mountain passes, monasteries, and vibrant cultural heritage. A paradise for adventure enthusiasts and nature lovers.

places.name: Rann of Kutch
places.description: Known for its vast salt marshes, the Rann of Kutch is a unique desert landscape that transforms into a white salt desert during the dry season. It hosts the Rann Utsav, a cultural festival celebrating the rich heritage and crafts of Gujarat.

wonder.name: Taj Mahal
wonder.description: A stunning white marble mausoleum, known for its intricate architecture and as a symbol of eternal love.

wonder.name: Jaipur's Hawa Mahal
wonder.description: A palace with a unique honeycomb design, allowing royal women to observe street festivals without being seen.

wonder.name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves
wonder.description: Ancient rock-cut caves showcasing exquisite paintings and sculptures, reflecting Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain traditions.

wonder.name: Golden Temple
wonder.description: A sacred Sikh shrine known for its stunning golden architecture and the reflective pool surrounding it.

wonder.name: Victoria Memorial
wonder.description: A large marble building dedicated to Queen Victoria, showcasing a blend of British and Mughal architectural styles.

wonder.name: Gateway of India
wonder.description: An iconic arch monument built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary, overlooking the Arabian Sea.

wonder.name: Mysore Palace
wonder.description: A grand palace with a mix of architectural styles, serving as the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty.

wonder.name: Hampi
wonder.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Hampi is an ancient city known for its magnificent ruins, ancient temples, and historical significance.

adventure.description: Experience breathtaking views, diverse cultures, and challenging treks in the highest mountain range in the world.
Navigate thrilling rapids on some of Indiaâ€™s most exciting rafting destinations, surrounded by natural beauty.
Soar above picturesque valleys or coastal areas, taking in panoramic vistas while experiencing the ultimate adrenaline rush.

adventure.location: Lakshadweep Islands, Andaman Nicobar Islands, Goa
adventure.description: Explore vibrant coral reefs teeming with marine life, discover hidden underwater caves, and enjoy crystal clear waters.
Float gently over historic sites, vast deserts, or verdant forests, enjoying bird's eye views from serene heights.

adventure.location: Corbett National Park, Bandhavgarh National Park, Kaziranga National Park
adventure.description: Encounter majestic tigers, elephants, rhinos, and various other wildlife species during exhilarating jungle safaris.

entry-fees.free: Free for children below 15 years of age

unesco-site.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, Maharashtra
unesco-site.location: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus Area, Fort, Mumbai, Maharashtra

unesco-site.name: Victorian and Art Deco Ensembles of Mumbai, Maharashtra
Khajuraho Group of Monuments, Madhya Pradesh
Buddhist Monuments at Sanchi, Madhya Pradesh
unesco-site.location: Sanchi town, Raisen district, Madhya Pradesh

unesco-site.name: Rock Shelters of Bhimbetka, Madhya Pradesh
unesco-site.location: Raisen District, Madhya Pradesh (45 km from Bhopal)
